sales force automation is one of the most ambitious complex and challenging programs the lorillard sales organization has ever attempted to implement it is a project requiring on Prince den and coordination communication and teamwork not only among Laurel our departments such as Finance marketing legal Mis and sales but also with outside vendors such as IBM who is providing Consulting Services
Gateway systems who is designing the software and TR G conducting the training and providing help desk and Depot services

although several individuals have made significant contributions to the success of the project to date I think the important story is about the large number of lorillard people who pulled together as a team to meet seemingly impossible deadlines and challenges their commitment to the success of sales force automation will provide lorillard with the tools and information we need to grow our business in an increasingly complex and fast-paced business environment
in July as a result of the strong team effort the software program called link an acronym for lorillard Information Network was ready for field testing
five sales representatives and five Managers from Area 1 put the link program through its paces

the objectives of the pre pilot were to test the link program and identify specific areas that needed refinement test the training program and test the two pen-based tablet computers that were under consideration for the sales representatives use
the pre pilot team had high accolades for the link program in fact we had to do some arm wrestling to get the tablet computers away from those sales representatives
as a result of their efforts we were able to identify some areas of the program that needed refinement as well as some pieces that could be made more user-friendly
additionally due to their recommendations a decision was made to utilize the Fujitsu stylistic 1200
the Fujitsu is approximately 11 by 7 inches and weighs slightly under 4 pounds because it utilizes a pain to enter information it is very user-friendly and a very portable unit

the second field test of link will start in January when all members of the Charlotte and Portland region received their Link Training during this timeframe we will be tweaking the link program to ensure it meets all requirements for National implementation

the National Rollout is projected to begin in mid-march and to be completed by the end of May although the entire sales force will be using linked by the end of May this is not the end of the project but rather a very big First Step link will be rolled out in several releases the first release contains many features that will immediately help us to better manage our business information will be more accurate current and easier to retrieve
since sales representatives will transmit each evening managers will have access to their retail information in less than 24 hours
paperwork will be reduced resulting in increased productivity

the permanent display list Consignment account VPI draft register most promotion notices and all paper copies of CRS reports will be eliminated all the information contained in these reports can be obtained through link
our ability to micromanage will be greatly enhanced through more effective targeting of merchandising Promotional and Manpower resources

Communications will improve release one of link will allow a manager to book a promotion and get the promotion notice including an authorized signature to all sales representatives involved by the very next day the chain authorized signature will be captured electronically using a device called a Wacom which is the white tablet you see attached to this computer
are chain account managers and selected division managers will receive this device during the rollout

this is how the link generated promotional offers will look when a sales representative receives it they can either print a hard copy to show store personnel or have them view the authorization on screen
even though release one will not be fully rolled out until the end of May work has already begun on future releases
some of the features being explored for release to in late 1988 include computer-generated expense accounts supplier item code numbers that are linked to individual retail accounts
targeted user-friendly surveys that automatically compiled as information is transmitted
one of the most exciting features that has planned to be included in a future release is the ability to view each retail store shipments by packing

this information will allow us to increase the productivity efficiency and effectiveness of the field sales organization through improved micro marketing and more effective targeting of our merchandising Promotional and Manpower resources
and now by plane will review the XL wholesale program and explain how it links up with Salesforce automation

Gene just reviewed several features that Salesforce automation will provide in the future in order for lorillard to be able to do this we had to develop a program which would give us access to the information needed to implement these features

as a result through the combined efforts of Mis Finance marketing and field sales working together lorillard successfully developed a new direct account program which was introduced on July 1st 1996 the Excel wholesale program this program is comprised of two levels level one basic participation and level two sales information data or retail shipment data

retail shipment data is defined as shipments to retail locations sub jabbers Wholesale Club's distribution centers are other locations which are lorillard direct accounts supplies it is this data which has become the critical information needed to accomplish many of the features Gene mentioned earlier

these features however represent only a few of the many benefits this data can provide lorillard as market conditions change almost daily and has become more important than ever for strategic planning purposes to have a cure for record information so the right product is in the right location with the right promotion
retail shipment data helps us to do this therefore it was very important for the field sales organization to sell the new Excel Hotel program to as many accounts as possible

I'm pleased to say that since its Inception through the combined efforts of many managers working together lorillard was successful in society up 1140 direct accounts to level 2 of the program if we back out the military government and other locations would basically do not participate in these programs the 1140 direct accounts represents 78% of our viable accounts
however more importantly this allows lorillard to receive retail shipment data from accounts representing ninety-two percent of our total volume
exceeding the percentage of business Philip Morris RJ Reynolds and brought a Williamson are receiving from their programs you should all take great pride in this outstanding achievement
now that we're able to obtain the information what have we done with it
obtaining information based on what is being shipped to the retail calls in each lorillard division as enable us to do many things and now in a more accurate manner
one of the first accomplishments was in addition to the quarterly share report we now also get this report based on Excel data
the Excel data is compiled from retail shipment data which is reflective of what is shipped to the retail calls within each lorillard division

this allows lorillard to be more competitive in the marketplace as the brand group and sales planning have utilized this information to recommend tear changes in our Newport and old gold marketing plans

another recent utilization of the information was the implementation of an expanded can heavier program in 1998 markets were chosen not only because we have more accurate lorillard data but we now also have more accurate competitive data

another key area where this information has and will be useful is the selection and evaluation of test markets or test programs in the past one of the toughest decisions was picking the correct market for the correct brand and being able to read the results

tree and shipments between divisions influence both the selection and evaluation process retail shipment data eliminates the transshipment problem and now the results of these tests can be read more accurately
the examples reviewed so far have been based on the Excel quarterly share report which is a document we have made available on a regular basis
information of a more specific nature can also be obtained based on our needs
for example senior Vice President of Sales Randy spell and general manager trade development Leo Weber were planning an appointment with McLane Corporation

McClain is Laura large largest customer Randy s Leo if we could get information for each individual McClain Warehouse indicating share of Market by class of trade by company comparing last year share to this year's share to see if any significant changes had occurred
a report was produced based on each MacLean Warehouse as well as a grand total of all McLane warehouses showing the information Randy had requested
information was just a year and a half ago we would not have been available to lower leg

what about the future one of the ultimate goals is to merge this information with our sales force automation system so each sales rep will have access at the touch of his or her stylist on the computer screen to store specific data which could be broken down to individual brand information for both lorillard and our competitors

both the MSA and Excel share reports are broken down by company and by division in the future our Excel program will provide the field sales organization with sales information by class or trade for each company as well
first giving field management the opportunity to determine if any micro marketing opportunities are available
another example of what Excel can do for us in the future is we will have the ability to pinpoint those stores in the division state or region where cool box has more volume than Newport box
this information would allow us to plan strategies Target promotions and Implement programs to build our business

the benefits of the information of this information are endless the examples presented today are just the tip of the iceberg as our industry continues to change it will be even more important to react to those changes

for example the Excel wholesale program was not designed to stay as it is with only two levels it was developed with the intent that is market conditions or company objectives change the program could be refined or enhanced by adding additional requirements or levels

currently work is in progress to develop a third element or a level a level which would assist the distributors in offsetting the potential increased carrying cost of inventory due to the proposed settlement or resolution
if the carrying cost of inventory increases substantially the decision to stack certain brands could be a significant issue with our customers
level 3 could provide an incentive to the Distributors to continue to carry and distribute these products

having the retail shipment data available and updating our program to meet our needs will give us the ability to work together as a team to plan strategies which will allow lorillard to continue to be proactive rather than reactive and continue to develop the programs and promotions which have allowed this great company to be the competitive successful and profitable company it is

package merchandising plan by 1997 That Grew by nine percent to seventy three thousand retail stores this was a direct result of two very successful initiatives Lord's entry into the price value arena in 1992 and in 1995 we increased our retail presence dramatically in inner-city New Port number one Club locations by working together we made it happen

even though there was an overall increase in stores participating in package merchandising plans in General market calls we experienced a decline package plans were lost in a total of 7,000 stores that was a ten percent decline in the area of carton merchandising stores participating in lower large plans decline from thirty four thousand six hundred in 1992 27300

under in 1997 at loss of 21 percent although the number of stores participating and Laura large carton merchandising plans decline we were not at a competitive disadvantage within the industry as the number of retail outlets with any form of carton merchandising also declined by 21%
this was a result of a shift from carton to pack purchase and AD emphasis of carton self-service merchandising by typical carton retailers

overall stores participating in package plans in the General market were declining and working together to reverse these declines was a priority to meet lorillard merchandising objectives first we had to determine the factors impacting declines in package displays in General Market locations there were many competitive pressure was significant

the competition was increasing their demands for counter space and was also significantly increasing their monthly payments Philip Morris is market share and monthly payments supported their efforts to gain package counter displays while demanding that to competition be limited to a less impactful position or no display at all
